meanings.definition: A person who talks or acts in a deceptive or insincere way.
meanings.sent1: That jiveass always tries to trick people with his lies.
meanings.sent2: Don't trust that jiveass; he's always pretending to be someone he's not.
meanings.sent3: The jiveass thought he could fool everyone with his fake stories.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his jiveass ways and refused to believe his tall tales.
meanings.sent5: The jiveass's deceitful behavior was as clear as day to those around him.

meanings.definition: To deceive or mislead someone with insincere talk or behavior.
meanings.sent1: He tried to jiveass his way out of trouble by making up excuses.
meanings.sent2: Stop trying to jiveass me with your false promises; I know the truth.
meanings.sent3: She attempted to jiveass her teacher into thinking she had done her homework.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was full of jiveass statements to sway the crowd.
meanings.sent5: His smooth talking couldn't jiveass the fact that he was caught red-handed.
